title: Zero-fill data — format_zero_fill
text: df_db Either data frame connection database naturecounts table (data frame returned). Character vector. default, "SamplingEventIdentifier" vector specific column names fill (see details) species Character vector. Either "", species data, vector species ID codes fill . fill Character. column name fill . Defaults "ObservationCount". extra_species Character vector. Extra columns/fields uniquely associated species_id keep data (columns , species, fill, extra_species, extra_event omitted result). extra_event Character vector. Extra columns/fields uniquely associated Sampling Event (field defined ) keep data (columns , species, fill, extra_species, extra_event) omitted result). warn Logical. TRUE, stop zero-filling >100 species >1000 unique sampling events. FALSE, ignore proceed. verbose Logical. Show messages?

title: Zero-fill data — format_zero_fill
text: Data frame

title: Zero-fill data — format_zero_fill
text: refers combination columns used detect missing values. default SamplingEventIdentifier used. Otherwise users can specify combination columns. species supplied, records used determine observation events, records (zero-filled otherwise) correspond species species returned (others omitted). Note records species_id NA (generally 0 counts presence/absence), converted list 0's individual species.

title: Zero-fill data — format_zero_fill
code: # Download data (with "core" fields to include 'CommonName') sample <- nc_data_dl(collection = c("SAMPLE1", "SAMPLE2"), fields_set = "core",                      username = "sample", info = "nc_example") #> Using filters: collections (SAMPLE1, SAMPLE2); fields_set (BMDE2.00) #> Collecting available records... #>   collection nrecords #> 1    SAMPLE1      991 #> 2    SAMPLE2      995 #> Total records: 1,986 #>  #> Downloading records for each collection: #>   SAMPLE1 #>     Records 1 to 991 / 991 #>   SAMPLE2 #>     Records 1 to 995 / 995  # Remove casual observations (i.e. 'AllSpeciesReported' = "No") library(dplyr) # For filter function #>  #> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’ #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’: #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’: #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union sample <- filter(sample, AllSpeciesReported == "Yes")  # Remove data with "X" ObservationCount (only keep numeric obs) sample <- filter(sample, ObservationCount != "X")  # Zero fill by all species present sample_all_zeros <- format_zero_fill(sample) #>  - Converted 'fill' column (ObservationCount) from character to numeric  # Zero fill only for Canada Goose goose <- format_zero_fill(sample, species = "230") #>  - Converted 'fill' column (ObservationCount) from character to numeric  # Keep species-specific variables goose <- format_zero_fill(sample, species = "230", extra_species = "CommonName") #>  - Converted 'fill' column (ObservationCount) from character to numeric  # Keep sampling-event-specific variables coords <- format_zero_fill(sample, extra_event = c("latitude", "longitude")) #>  - Converted 'fill' column (ObservationCount) from character to numeric  # By species, keeping extra species variables and event variables goose_coords <- format_zero_fill(sample, species = "230",                                  extra_species = "CommonName",                                  extra_event = c("latitude", "longitude")) #>  - Converted 'fill' column (ObservationCount) from character to numeric  # Only return event information events <- format_zero_fill(sample, fill = NA,                            extra_event = c("latitude", "longitude"))

title: Download information about NatureCounts collections — nc_count
code: nc_count(   collections = NULL,   project_ids = NULL,   species = NULL,   years = NULL,   doy = NULL,   region = NULL,   site_type = NULL,   show = "available",   username = NULL,   timeout = 120,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Download information about NatureCounts collections — nc_count
text: collections Character vector. collection codes download data. NULL (default) downloads data available collections project_ids Character/Numeric vector. project ids download data. First collections associated project_id determined, data downloaded collection. collections project_ids supplied, combined. species Numeric vector. Numeric species ids (see details) years Numeric vector. start/end years data download. Can use NA either start end, single value return data single year. doy Character/Numeric vector. start/end day--year download (1-366 dates can converted day year). Can use NA either start end region List. Named list one following options: country, statprov, subnational2, iba, bcr, utm_squares, bbox. See details site_type Character vector. type site return (e.g., IBA). show Character. Either "" "available". "" returns counts data sources. "available" returns counts data available username provided. username provided, defaults "". username Character vector. Username http://naturecounts.ca. provided, user prompted password. left NULL, public collections returned. timeout Numeric. Number seconds connecting server times . verbose Logical. Show messages?

title: Download information about NatureCounts collections — nc_count

title: Download information about NatureCounts collections — nc_count

title: Download information about NatureCounts collections — nc_count
text: format day year (doy) fairly flexible can whole number 1 366 anything recognized lubridate-package's ymd() function. However, must order year, month, day. Note year ignored converting day year, except result 1 day offset leap years.

title: Download information about NatureCounts collections — nc_count
text: Regions defined codes reflecting country, state/province, subnational (level 2), Important Bird Areas (IBA), Bird Conservation Regions (BCR) (see search_region() codes). can also defined providing specific UTM squares download bounding box area specifies min/max longitude min/max latitude (bbox). See article regional filters information.

title: Download information about NatureCounts collections — nc_count
text: Access data collection either available "full" "request". Use nc_count(username = "USER", show = ""), see accessibility collections. "Full" access means data can immediately requested directly naturecounts R package. "request" means request must submitted online approved data can downloaded naturecounts. means two types data requests: ones made naturecounts R package (API requests) made online Web Request Form (Web requests). Every request (either method) generates request_id identifies filter set collections requested. Details requests can reviewed nc_requests() function. download data "full" access, users can either specify filters, repeating download, can use request_id nc_requests(). Otherwise, user "full" access, must supply approved request_id nc_data_dl() function (e.g., nc_data_dl(request_id = 152000, username = "USER")). Use nc_requests() see request_ids, filters, approval status. Requests "full" access additional collections can made online Web Request Form checking "Full access?" box Step 2 form.

title: Download NatureCounts data records — nc_data_dl
text: collections Character vector. collection codes download data. NULL (default) downloads data available collections project_ids Character/Numeric vector. project ids download data. First collections associated project_id determined, data downloaded collection. collections project_ids supplied, combined. species Numeric vector. Numeric species ids (see details) years Numeric vector. start/end years data download. Can use NA either start end, single value return data single year. doy Character/Numeric vector. start/end day--year download (1-366 dates can converted day year). Can use NA either start end region List. Named list one following options: country, statprov, subnational2, iba, bcr, utm_squares, bbox. See details site_type Character vector. type site return (e.g., IBA). fields_set Character. Set fields/columns download. See details. fields Character vector. fields_set = custom, fields/columns download. See details username Character vector. Username http://naturecounts.ca. provided, user prompted password. left NULL, public collections returned. info Character vector. Short description reason download. E.g., "COSEWIC report", "Impact Assessment Study", "School project", etc. kind information helps NatureCounts.ca justify utility database. Required unless resuming/re-downloaded request_id. request_id Numeric. Specific request id check download. sql_db Character vector. Name location SQLite database either create add warn Logical. Interactive warning request 1,000,000 records download. timeout Numeric. Number seconds connecting server times . verbose Logical. Show messages?

title: Download NatureCounts data records — nc_data_dl
text: default data downloaded minimum set fields/columns. However, advanced applications, users may wish specify fields/columns return. Bird Monitoring Data Exchange (BMDE) schema keeps track variables used augment observation data. different versions reflecting different collections variables can specified download one four ways: fields_set can specific shorthand reflecting BMDE version: core, extended minimum (default). See meta_bmde_versions() see BMDE version shorthand refers . fields_set can default uses default BMDE version particular collection (note download one collection, field sets expand cover fields/columns combined collections) fields_set can exact BMDE version. See meta_bmde_versions() options. fields_set can custom fields argument can character vector specifying exact fields/columns return. See meta_bmde_fields()) potential fields values. Note cases set fields/columns always returned, matter fields_set used.

what: Download list of accessible collections — nc_permissions
title: Download list of accessible collections — nc_permissions
text: Returns list collections accessible 'username'.

title: Download list of accessible collections — nc_permissions
code: nc_permissions(username = NULL, timeout = 60)

title: Download list of accessible collections — nc_permissions
text: username Character vector. Username http://naturecounts.ca. provided, user prompted password. left NULL, public collections returned. timeout Numeric. Number seconds connecting server times .

title: Download list of accessible collections — nc_permissions
text: public data available username/password (sign free NatureCounts account). However, access private/semi-public projects/collections must request access. See Access request_ids section information.

title: Download list of accessible collections — nc_permissions
text: Access data collection either available "full" "request". Use nc_count(username = "USER", show = ""), see accessibility collections. "Full" access means data can immediately requested directly naturecounts R package. "request" means request must submitted online approved data can downloaded naturecounts. means two types data requests: ones made naturecounts R package (API requests) made online Web Request Form (Web requests). Every request (either method) generates request_id identifies filter set collections requested. Details requests can reviewed nc_requests() function. download data "full" access, users can either specify filters, repeating download, can use request_id nc_requests(). Otherwise, user "full" access, must supply approved request_id nc_data_dl() function (e.g., nc_data_dl(request_id = 152000, username = "USER")). Use nc_requests() see request_ids, filters, approval status. Requests "full" access additional collections can made online Web Request Form checking "Full access?" box Step 2 form.

title: Custom table queries — nc_query_table
text: Generate custom table queries table name filter arguments.

title: Custom table queries — nc_query_table
code: nc_query_table(   table = NULL,   ...,   username = NULL,   timeout = 120,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Custom table queries — nc_query_table
text: table Character. Table query (see details) ... Name/value pairs custom queries/filters (see details) username Character vector. Username http://naturecounts.ca. provided, user prompted password. left NULL, public collections returned. timeout Numeric. Number seconds connecting server times . verbose Logical. Show messages?

title: Custom table queries — nc_query_table
text: data.frame()

title: Custom table queries — nc_query_table
text: nc_query_table(username = "sample") available options

title: Custom table queries — nc_query_table
code: # What tables are available? What 'filters' do they take? Are any 'required'?  nc_query_table(username = "sample") #>              table_name                        filters required #> 1    AtlasSquareSummary                 statprove_code       NA #> 2 bmde_filter_bad_dates project_id,SiteCode,species_id       NA #> 3                 Rnest                           <NA>       NA #> 4         RnestMetadata                           <NA>       NA #> 5    SpeciesLifeHistory                           <NA>       NA  # Query the bmdefilter_bad_dates table  d <- nc_query_table(table = "bmde_filter_bad_dates", username = "sample") head(d) #>   survey_month species_id period                   comments project_id SiteCode #> 1            0          0 spring              beaver damage       1005     ACBO #> 2            0          0 spring              beaver damage       1005     ACBO #> 3            0          0 spring                   missing        1005      BBO #> 4            0          0 spring                   missing        1005      BBO #> 5            0          0      0           covid disruption       1005      BBO #> 6            0       7680      0 began NSWO surveys in 2000       1005      BBO #>   survey_year start_year end_year survey_day #> 1        2019          0        0          0 #> 2        2022          0        0          0 #> 3        2002          0        0          0 #> 4        2019          0        0          0 #> 5        2020          0        0          0 #> 6           0          0     1999          0  # Filter our query d <- nc_query_table(table = "bmde_filter_bad_dates",                     SiteCode = "DMBO", username = "sample") d #>   survey_month species_id period                                   comments #> 1            1          0      0 Changed sites in spring in 2006 - new site #> 2            2          0      0 Changed sites in spring in 2006 - new site #> 3            3          0      0 Changed sites in spring in 2006 - new site #> 4            4          0      0 Changed sites in spring in 2006 - new site #> 5            5          0      0 Changed sites in spring in 2006 - new site #> 6            6          0      0 Changed sites in spring in 2006 - new site #> 7            0          0      0              Oak Hammock Marsh covid dates #>   project_id SiteCode survey_year start_year end_year survey_day #> 1       1005     DMBO           0          0     2005          0 #> 2       1005     DMBO           0          0     2005          0 #> 3       1005     DMBO           0          0     2005          0 #> 4       1005     DMBO           0          0     2005          0 #> 5       1005     DMBO           0          0     2005          0 #> 6       1005     DMBO           0          0     2005          0 #> 7       1005     DMBO        2020          0        0          0  # Filter our query d <- nc_query_table(table = "bmde_filter_bad_dates",                     species_id = 15770, username = "sample")                      # Want more than one species? Either filter after, or combine two queries  # Filter after library(dplyr) d <- nc_query_table(table = "bmde_filter_bad_dates", username = "sample") d <- filter(d, species_id %in% c(15770, 9750))  # Combine two queries d1 <- nc_query_table(table = "bmde_filter_bad_dates",                      species_id = 15770, username = "sample") d2 <- nc_query_table(table = "bmde_filter_bad_dates",                      species_id = 9750, username = "sample") d <- rbind(d1, d2)

title: Find species codes — search_species

text: name Character. species name search show Character. Either "" "names" (default). Whether return taxonomic information subset species names authority Character. NULL (default), return alphanumeric code associated avian species taxonomic authority.

what: Search for bird species id codes by alphanumeric codes — search_species_code
title: Search for bird species id codes by alphanumeric codes — search_species_code
text: advanced function returning Bird-related species id codes based various alphanumeric codes used different authorities.

title: Search for bird species id codes by alphanumeric codes — search_species_code
code: search_species_code(code = NULL, authority = "BSCDATA", results = "all")

title: Search for bird species id codes by alphanumeric codes — search_species_code
text: code Vector. Character numeric code indicating species given authority. authority Character. authority compare codes (defaults "BSCDATA") results Character. "" returns codes related species (including subspecies main species). "exact" returns code exact species indicated code.

title: Search for bird species id codes by alphanumeric codes — search_species_code
text: data frame numeric species id codes names

text: species_code_search() deprecated favour search_species_code() Species ids returned reflect species sub-species levels.

title: Fetch authorization token — srv_auth
text: given username, check see already token storage environment srv_auth_env, otherwise prompt safely password fetch token NatureCounts server.

title: Fetch authorization token — srv_auth
code: srv_auth(username)

title: Fetch authorization token — srv_auth
text: username Character vector. Username http://naturecounts.ca. provided, user prompted password. left NULL, public collections returned.

title: Fetch authorization token — srv_auth
text: Token character string

title: Tidy eval helpers — tidyeval
text: sym() creates symbol string syms() creates list symbols character vector. expr() quo() quote one expression. quo() wraps quoted expression quosure. plural variants rlang::exprs() quos() return list quoted expressions quosures. enexpr() enquo() capture expression supplied argument user current function (enquo() wraps expression quosure). enexprs() enquos() capture multiple expressions supplied arguments, including .... exprs() exported avoid conflicts Biobase::exprs(), therefore one always use rlang::exprs(). learn tidy eval use tools, visit http://rlang.r-lib.org Metaprogramming section Advanced R.

title: naturecounts 0.4.1
text: Truly allow different columns Also allow species_id record_id columns

title: naturecounts 0.4.0
text: Add tools COSEWIC assessments Fix bug search_species() returned authorities Updated dependency dplyr 1.1.0 Updated tests testthat 3rd edition Re-wrote internal requests formatting improve speed nc_dl_data() returns warning (error) data given set filters (facilitate looping downloads) Warn (error) database created older version package

title: naturecounts 0.3.0
text: Add nc_query_table() arbitrary custom table queries Implement -memory query caching (lasts 4 hours session restarts) Added nc_remove_cache() remove -memory cache needed

title: naturecounts 0.2.3
text: switch back regular server (sandbox) use house finches example data frame rather barred owls

text: Arrange returned data fields sensibly

text: Fixed bug data extraction nc_data_dl() nc_counts()

title: naturecounts 0.2.0
